elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: SCOTLAND 1780. THE MOORS.
(LOW, ALMOST TO HIMSELF) So... the Redcoats are attacking again. Taking our woman and bairns, killing our men folk. (BECOMING LOUDER) Well I tell ye, we shall stand against them!
LOW ROARS OF APPROVAL
I, Black Donald, give you my pledge, they shall not beat us! For Scotland and freedom!
(ROWDY, FIRED UP) For Scotland and freedom!
CUT TO...
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2: SCOTLAND 1780. HILLS ABOVE A HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY.
FX: HORSE STAMPS, MILITARY DRUMS PLAY AND STOP.
Present arms!
FX: CLATTER OF MUSKETS AT THE READY.
(ON HORSEBACK ADDRESSING A COLUMN OF TROOPS 5 METRES OFF) You know the drill. Women and children to be rounded up. But no man
left alive. Then burn it, burn the village to the ground. BURN IT!
MUSIC: TITLE MUSIC
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 3: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY
(FX: RUNNING, CHILDREN CRYING. CHICKENS AND SHEEP. URGENT VOICES.
RUMBLE. THE VILLAGE IS EXPECTING THE ATTACK. )
(CALLS OFF) Bring the wagons! Turn them over!
FX: WAGON UPENDED
Get those bairns away there. For pity’s sake hurry, the Redcoats’11l soon be upon us.
FX: FADE UP TARDIS MATERIALISATION, SOME WAY OFF.
What in the name of heaven was that...?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 4: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE. BETWEEN THE LINES. — DAY
FX: TARDIS MATERIALIZATION COMPLETES. TARDIS DOOR OPENS
Ahhh... (BREATHES DEEP) Been a while since I’ve smelt air that fresh.
FX: A SHOT ZINGS OVERHEAD
Oh! Well that’s not a very friendly welcome!
(SOME WAY OFF, BEHIND CART, STEREO RIGHT.) Get down, ya’ bampot!
(FAR OFF, STEREO LEFT) Fire!
FX: FUSILLADE FROM REDCOATS, STEREO LEFT.
Good idea! Oof! (AS WE HEAR HIM HIT THE GROUND)
FX: MUSKET BALLS WHIZZ PAST
(TO HIMSELF) I think I’d better get out of here.
(CALLS OFF, STEREO RIGHT) Return fire!
FX: RAGGED, HIGHLANDER FUSILLADE, STEREO RIGHT.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 5: EXT. HILLS ABOVE A HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY.
Who the devil is that? (CALLS OFF) Sergeant Rilke!
Yes, Major, sir?
Where did that man come from?
Out of that blue box, I believe, Major.
No more stragglers, you hear me? Now bring up the cannon and let’s get this over with.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 6: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY
(FX: IN HIGHLANDER LINES NOW. GUNS LOADED, SWORDS DRAWN, CLANSMEN
OFF)
FX: APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS OF DOCTOR RUNNING INTO VILLAGE.
(OUT OF BREATH, RUNNING) Don’t shoot!
Well, you’re no a Redcoat, I’1l give ya that! Why’d ya not disappear back into yon magic box?
(DROPS BESIDE GUTHRIE) Oof! Er... oh, well, those Redcoats rather cut me off from— (the old girl)
Can you fire a pistol?
Probably, but I’ve no intention of trying.
Pistol or no, you’re a target, man.
Hmm, Redcoats and Highlanders. Strange, I didn’t think I was anywhere near this time and place. I’d just picked up some kind of strange algorithm —
Who the hell are you?
I’m known as the Doctor.
Are you now? Well, my name’s Will Guthrie, Doctor, and I’d watch myself if I was you. With that accent you could pass for an Englishman yourself. Mind, you look more like a French dandy!
I’1ll take that as a compliment. But what exactly is going on here?
We’re to hold the line against those Redcoats up on the hill there, ‘til Black Donald and his men arrive. (CALLS OFF) Clan Mackintosh! Are you ready to drive them back?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 9
(RAGGEDLY) Aye!!!
Wait, wait. For heaven’s sake, look, they’re bringing up a cannon! You’1ll be blown to pieces.
We have to keep them from the village, we’ve women and bairns here.
If you tackle those Redcoats head-on you won’t get within a hundred yards. At least put a defensive line there, by your carts. Then send men up the slope there, see? That way you can’t be flanked.
Aye, that might work, Frenchman. But Black Donald says we’re to attack, and we Mackintoshes will not yield. (CALLS OFF) Are you ready, boys? Loch Moigh!!
Loch Moigh!!
FX: MEN ADVANCE. SHOTS
No! It’s suicide!
FX: CANNON FIRE BOOMS, FROM UP THE HILL
Look out!
FX: SHELL HITS. THE DOCTOR IS THROWN
AAAAARGH!
CUT TO SILENCE.
HOLD, THEN SLOWLY FADE UP ON...
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 7: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY
FX: SLAPPING
Let’s be having you! Come on, wake up.
(COMING ROUND) Hm, what... ?
On your feet!
Alright, let me check I’ve got all my limbs first.
(FX: APPROACHING ON HORSEBACK, SCATTERING A FEW CHICKENS) What’s that you’ve got there, Sergeant?
Sir! Found it shamming dead among the chickens.
I was not shamming! I was actually unconscious!
(HORSEBACK) Who are you? (BEAT) Out with it!
What happened to the man I was talking to? Where are the villagers?
Dead, most likely. Now answer the question. You look French.
I am not French!
A Yankee, then?
I’m the Doctor. Look, what year is this? Seventeen forty, seventeen fifty?
Are you a simpleton or are you just trying my patience? This is the year seventeen hundred and eighty.
And you are?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 11
You, sir, are addressing Major Heyward of His Majesty’s 78" Regiment of Foot. Now, if you are a doctor, I have injured that need attending to.
I’m not that kind of doctor.
Any kind is better than the sawbones we’ve got.
Exactly. And it’s either that or I have you shot as a Jacobean
spy.
(HEAVY SIGH) Doesn’t matter where it is, or what period, does it? There’s always some tinpot tyrant ready to solve every problem with a gun.
What did you say?
Never mind.
‘Where it is or what period’! That strikes me as an odd turn of phrase, sir. I think our Overlord will want to talk to you.
Who?
Sergeant, take this man to our injured. And keep him under guard.
FX: RIDES OFF
You heard the Major.
Who exactly is this Overlord of yours?
You best not ask questions like that, less’n you want to know the answer. And take it from me, you don’t. Now do what you can for these men.
Yes but...!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 12
(SOME WAY OFF) Help me! Help me please. (COUGHING AND
Yes, yes of course.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 8: EXT. HILLS ABOVE VILLAGE —- DAY.
FX: MEN SHIFTING SHIELDS, SCABBARDS, MUSKETS. HORSES
(APPROACHING) Black Donald! Thank God you’ve come!
Will Guthrie. How went the battle?
We attacked, but Heyward’s men drove us from the village.
That butcher. How many men has he?
Four-score, maybe even a hundred. They were too many for us, Donald.
But still — you attacked them head-on? What were you thinking, man? It’d be suicide.
Aye, I see that now. The Frenchman said as much.
Frenchman?
Aye, came into the village before the attack.
Well, take what men you have left and hit their flank yonder, see?
Aye, I do.
Half my men will take them on the other side. I’1l1 bring the rest through the village. If you find Heyward, leave him to me. (TO
MEN) Let the pipes play!
FX: BAGPIPES START UP.
For Scotland, and for our freedom!
For Scotland! (DESCENDING INTO ROWDY CHEERS)
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 9: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE —- DAY
(WEAK, PAINED) In God’s name, sawbones — make it stop...
Easy now. There’s water here —
GLUGS, DRIBBLES
Not too fast —
FX: DISTANT PIPES — THE HIGHLANDERS APPROACHING
(OFF) Oh my eye! Highlanders! It must be Black Donald’s men. (CALLS OFF) Quickly, to your firing lines!
(OFF) Form up there!
FX: SHOTS. CLANSMEN SCREAMS GETTING CLOSER. CHARGING CLANSMEN
From the frying pan into the fire, it would seem.
FX: OFF, NEIGH OF HEYWARD’S HORSE.
(OFF) There’s too many of them! Withdraw! Withdraw!
Black Donald. He’s a terror, he’ll murder us —
Not if I’ve got anything to do with it.
(OFF) Withdraw! Come on, get a move on, unless you want those kilted devils to slit yer throats for you! Withdraw!
(FX: HEYWARD’S HORSE THUNDERS OFF. RUNNING FOOTSTEPS AND CRIES OF
RETREATING. )
(VARIOUSLY) Come on! Withdraw! Move it! Let’s get out of here!
etc.
(FAR OFF NOW) Leave the wounded!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 15
For pity’s sake, don’t leave me-!
I’m not planning to.
FX: THE CLANSMEN ARRIVE, SCREAMING.
VARIOUSLY) Look at them run! Cowards! Redcoat cowards! (etc.
(RUNS UP, OUT OF BREATH) Well I’1l be, it’s the Frenchman! You've got prisoners then, eh?
(WEAKER THAN EVER) Mercy-!
Sure. (FX: COCKING PISTOL) I’1ll ease your pain —
FX: A SHOT
DIES
That’s murder-!
Aye, the same way they murder us.
An eye for an eye, ‘til we all go blind — is that it?
Ah, with wounds like that, the dog’d never have lasted the night.
I understand you have no love of the English, but he was still a man.
It’s hard these days to tell men from puppets.
‘Puppets.’ Of King George the Second, I suppose?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 16
The King?!? What does the King want in all this?
I assumed this rebellion is against the Highland Clearances, and for the restoration of James Stuart?
No, man — that was my father’s battle. Come on, Black Donald will want to see you.
Black Donald?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 10: EXT. HIGHLAND VILLAGE
FX: FADE UP
(TALKING TO LIEUTENANTS) Put pickets out beyond the village. Find out which way Heyward went and quickly before—
(APPROACHING) Donald! This is the Frenchman I was telling you about.
Oh, Black Donald, is it? Well, Mr Donald, or whoever you are — I want a word with you about proper treatment of the injured — (STOPS IN HIS TRACKS, SEEING JAMIE) Good grief.
He doesn’t sound like a Frenchman. (SNIFFS) Or smell like one.
LAUGH
Don’t you worry yourself, Frenchman. The wounded will be seen to.
Yes, I’ve seen the way this fellow ‘sees to’ the wounded. And I can’t believe you of all people [would condone —]
Will Guthrie. What’s he on about-?
Aye, well, we can barely feed ourselves, let alone the English wounded.
We’re not Heyward, Will Guthrie. Not butchers. You’1ll share your ration among the injured now.
But —
I said, now!
Donald. (EXITS)
Well said —
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 18
You. What’s your business here?
A BEAT
Of course... you wouldn’t recognise me.
I’ve not clapped eyes on you before.
No, no.. of course not. This is going to be a little difficult to explain... And judging by the look of you, it probably happened... what? Twenty, thirty years ago?
What happened twenty, thirty years ago?
But that can’t be right. Not if the Clearances are happening now. Hmmm.
You’d better start making some sense, Frenchie.
Look... I’m the Doctor. Does that mean anything to you?
Means you charge a pretty penny for a compress and a powder.
Mind you, I looked different back then.
Back when?

When we first met. The year was 1745. It was just after the Battle of Culloden. I was... er, shorter, then, with dark hair and... (THIS MIGHT JOG HIS MEMORY!) I had two friends with me, Polly and Ben. Remember? She was a long-legged beanpole of a thing, he was a sailor...
Sailors and beanpoles. (TURNING) Ah, I don’t have time for this —
Jamie... It’s me!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 19
(STOPPING IN HIS TRACKS) What did you call me-?
It is you, isn’t it? Jamie McCrimmon.
My name is Black Donald! What are you, an English spy?
James Robert McCrimmon, son of Donald, and a piper like his father. You served the Laird Colin McLaren at Culloden.
MUSIC: THE PIPES OF THE PAST
(SPOOKED) How do you know this?
I know it because I was your friend.
Was?
It’s difficult to explain.. In a way, we knew each other for a long time, but the Time Lords made you forget—
‘Time Lords’? What nonsense are ye speakin’ now?
(FRUSTRATED) Oh, this is ridiculous, you’1ll never believe me... But... Oh Jamie, I thought... I thought you were dead.
Indeed we are.
What?
All that live in this blighted place are already dead.
What do you mean? Jamie, when I knew you, you were one of the most ‘alive’ people I’d met—
What?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 20
You had such a spirit of.. of hope and—
Follow me, Doctor. There’s somethin’ I need to show you.
MUSIC: TRANSITIONAL.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 11: EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE —- DAY.
FX: SCRAMBLING ACROSS ROCKS. HARD GOING.
(EFFORT OF CLIMBING) This is rather a steep climb, Jamie!
We’re here! And tell me it wasn’t worth the sweat?
It’s a fantastic view!
It is that. But it’s not what you can see that I brought you here for. It’s what you can’t see.
And what exactly can’t I see?

Over there, at the far edge of the Kelpie’s Flow, that was the village of Leanoch. Across the peak, on the other side of the Lammermoor Estate, there was Car Mor. In the valley there, almost a hundred families lived at Breac. All gone now.
The Highland Clearances? Not a very honourable moment in British history.
Aye, but there’s another hand controlling the Redcoats.
FX: SWORD PULLED
Er... What’s the sword for? Jamie?
I don’t know how you found out my true name, but I will, before this day is done. Now — who are you? Guthrie said you appeared out of the air in a blue box, is that right?
The TARDIS, yes. Jamie, don’t you remember anything of—?
Did that fiend Red Cap send you? Speak up, man, or I’1l split you from belly to breakfast and throw you off this mountain!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 22
Threaten me all you like, Jamie, but something decidedly odd is going on here. And I’m rather hoping that you’1l explain it all to me. That Major down there—?
Heyward?
Yes, he mentioned the ‘Overlord’. Is this Overlord behind all this?
I’ve heard the name, but he’s not who I blame for this. Heyward and the Red Cap are the ones.
Red Cap?
I’ve only seen him once and even then he moved so quickly I couldn’t tell you what he looked like, other than his cap of blood. But the five men in front of me were mown down like grass.
A cap of blood?
That’s what I said. He drains the blood of his victims. More than that, his infernal machines are draining the very blood of Scotland itself.
(TO HIMSELF) Redcap, redcap.. (ALOUD) Of course, a creature of myth. A murderous goblin who slays travellers who stray from [the path —]
Red Cap is no myth!
Alright, alright. But will you please put that sword down, Jamie? I’ve no wish to have my belly slit and, as it happens, I haven’t had breakfast.
Very well, but tread carefully Doctor. I don’t trust you.
FX: SWORD SHEATHED
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 23
So I see. But perhaps you could show this Red Cap to me.
You want to see him?
If he’s the cause of everything that’s going wrong here... yes.
(LAUGHS) My men and I have tried to rid ourselves of him for years, and you, a French dandy...
For the last time, I am not a Frenchman!
And you, a dandy, are going to walk up to his castle and do what, exactly, Doctor?
Well, if you must know... Put a stop to whatever he’s doing to corrupt this timeline. (BEAT) Well, you did ask.
‘Time... line’? You’re saying you know a way to rid us of the Red Cap?
I’m saying I’m determined to find a way, and that the first step towards that is actually getting the measure of this... creature.
PAUSE.
Alright, Doctor.
You’1l take me to him?
I’1l take you. But I won’t risk the lives of any more of my men.
Quite right. We won’t need them anyway. It’1ll be just the two of us. (DELIGHTED) Quite like old times.
What old times? There’s something strange about you, Doctor.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 24
You do trust me though, don’t you? Hm? Or at least you want to trust me. I can see it in your eyes.
Och, you’re a sorcerer and that’s for sure!
No sorcery, Jamie. Just friendship. You see, when we knew each other before—
I’ve told ya, I don’t remember anything about you or—
I know... I know... But hear me out, Jamie. I know you want to.
Oh, do you now?

We were friends, you know. I put my life in your hands many times... and you trusted yours in mine. Perhaps I can’t explain in any way you’1ll truly understand.. All I can ask is that you follow your instincts, Jamie McCrimmon. Can you do that?
LONG PAUSE
I’m no’ makin’ any promises. Follow me.
MUSIC: TRANSITIONAL HIGHLAND TONES
it
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 12: EXT. THE HIGHLANDS - DAY
FX: WALKING
I’d forgotten how beautiful Scotland is. Look at that sunset!
It’s not all like this. Red Cap has blighted the land.
FX: WALKING STOPS
Exactly what does he look like?

He’s a short fellow with leathery skin, as though he’s been on the moors too long. His hair is long and grey. He owes his name to the red hat he wears. It’s said he dips it in the blood of his victims.
I see. Sounds decidedly odd.
And he’s fast! Even though he wears iron boots.
Iron boots?
You can hear him coming but you can’t outrun him. At night you can see the sparks his boots raise. And he can overcome even the strongest man.
I’m not saying he isn’t real, but it sounds to me like someone has taken on the appearance of a myth to strike fear into people.
Whatever he is, it works.
(WRYLY) And what about Black Donald? Is he a myth as well?
(LAUGHS) Black Donald is what people here call the Devil. To the Redcoats that’s what I am, so that’s who I became.
Don’t you have a family somewhere, a home?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 26
The Highlands are my home. My countrymen are my family. That’s all I need.
(SAD) I see...
FX: WALKING
But we must go, it’1ll be dark before we get off this mountain. And be on your guard — Mullach Castle, Red Cap’s lair, is just over yon ridge.
A castle! Well that’s appropriate, I suppose. An important man
must have an important house.
Aye, and it’s not without defences.
Soldiers? Redcoats?
MUSIC: UNEARTHLY THREAT.
Some of them were, once.
‘Once’?
We'll be safe if we keep moving. But keep your voice down.
FADE.
MUSIC: MORE TRANSITION TONES. SOME THREAT CREEPING IN.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 13: EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE - NIGHT. FADE UP
FX: WALKING
I can’t see a thing!
We must lay on.

Quite an unnatural mist rising up... (SNIFFS) I was rather enjoying stretching my legs in the fresh air, but it’s suddenly lost its appeal. (STUMBLES) Ow! This is absurd. I can’t even see where I’m putting my feet.
(AGITATED) We have to keep moving.
Jamie, what is it?
Down there is Gladsmuir. There was a battle there, a Jacobite victory and a glorious day by all accounts. But hundreds were killed, on both sides.
I’m sorry. But I really don’t see how that affects—
There are nights when the dead walk!
Ghosts? You’re expecting me to believe in ghosts?
FX: OFF, BAGPIPES
Call them what you will but they exist. Listen!.. Do you hear that? The pipes? Can you not hear the pipes?
Well, yes! Yes I can, but—
He’s come for us!
Who?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 28
We’ve got to get down. I’ve got to get away from here. Come on!
We can’t run in this fog! It’s too dangerous. We have to sit it out.
You heard the piper! He calls the dead.
Jamie, the only threat I can see is us falling and breaking our necks. This piper could, I don’t know, be... somebody just practising!
No-one lives out here, not anymore.
FX: ROCKS FALL
(TENSE) What was that? .. Oh, you see! You’ve got me at it now.
No, there! In the fog. Do you not see it?
Shadows. Just shadows in fog.
FX: ROCKS FALL
No, that’s a man! I’m sure of it.
MUSIC: SOMETHING OUT THERE.
FX: OFF, SOMETHING INDISTINCT RUNS
What was that?
FX: BAGPIPES, CLOSER THIS TIME
There he is again. Closer this time.
(RATTLED) I hear it. But we’ve got to stay calm.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 29
(WHISPERS) It’s the Phantom Piper. He’s come for me. And if you can hear him then... he’s come for us both.
The McCrimmon Piper?
How do you know that?
Jamie, I know this is hard for you to understand, but—
FX: CLOSER, TWO SOMETHINGS RUN
They’re coming for us! (MOVING OFF) We must go.
Jamie, wait. Jamie!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 14: EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE — CONTINUOUS.
FX: JAMIE RUNNING. BAGPIPES, EERIE IN THE DISTANCE
(OFF) Jamie, will you please stop-???
There’s no time, we’ve got to... (SLIPS) Agh!
FX: ROCKS FALL. JAMIE FALLS. HAND SLAPS ROCK. HE DANGLES
(DANGLING) Ah... my God! Doctor!
(APPROACHING) I’m coming, I’m coming. Where are you?
Here.
Jamie, good heavens! I didn’t realise we were so close to the edge! Take my hand!
I can’t... I can’t let go. I was right Doctor, the Piper was coming for me.

No, he’s not. Listen to me... Once before, a long time ago, you thought you saw the Piper. But you had a fever, you saw a metal man, a Cyberman. It was no piper. This is the same, the imagination playing tricks. Shadows in the fog; wind through the mountains. Nothing more. Now take my hand.
I can’t...
Reach!
FX: ROCKS SLIP. FINGERS SLIP
ARGH!
(OVER) Gotcha!
FX: JAMIE SCRAMBLES UP
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 31
(BREATHLESS) You saved my life!
(EXERTED) I’ve done it before. Quite a few times actually.
When? (DISBELIEVING) Oh aye, when you knew me before!
I think it’s time we got off this rather uncanny mountain, don’t you?
LIGHT LAUGH) Aye, Doctor. And... well... (STOPS HIMSELF
Yes, Jamie?
Thanks again, for saving my life.
You’re welcome, Jamie. (MUSIC: A PASSAGE OF TIME.)
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 32
SCENE 15: EXT. HIGHLANDS - DAY. FADE UP.
FX: WALKING
I’ve told you! I’ve no met you before. Not even if you did look shorter or had different hair.. and two friends, and that’s a fact!
Which is odd.
Oh, odd, is it? And why is that, Doctor?
FX: DOCTOR STOPS WALKING.
(CONFLICTED, ALMOST TO HIMSELF) Well... Hmmm... I’m not sure I should even tell you. I’m not sure I should risk upsetting what the Time Lords—
Ah, them again. There’s only one lord I’ve heard talked about around these parts, and that’s the Overlord.
And that’s the point. What Overlord? There was no ‘Overlord’ during this time period in Scotland.
‘Time period’?
There weren’t any Clearances, either. This whole situation is feeling more and more like a temporal foldback distortion as every minute passes.
Would you like to take a shot at explaining that too?
No. But even though the Time Lords erased your memory, their erasure took effect after our first encounter. So you should at least have a short memory of me, from before we left in the TARDIS.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 33
Look, Doctor, I can remember my whole life, everything as it was and as it should be.
Hmmm...
FX: DISTANT — METAL AGAINST STONE
Someone’s interfering, and it must have something to do with Redcap and this Overlord person.
Iron heels!
‘Tron’— ?
Listen!
That sounds like a train.
What is a ‘train’?
Of course, we’re a few years too early—
That’s Red Cap, Doctor. Remember I told you he has iron boots? That’s what you can hear. He’s running. Quickly now! Get down behind these rocks.
FX: THEY SCRAMBLE BEHIND THE ROCKS. SOUND OF RED CAP MOVING BY.
(SOTTO) Wait... I think... He’s moving away, I think. Yes. (SIGH OF
FX: MILITARY DRUM BEATS IN BACKGROUND.
Get down, Jamie. Redcoats.
(FX: MARCH PAST CONTINUES. A BODY OF 100+ TROOPS MARCH PAST. HORSES AND CARTS. )
How many, do you think?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 34
Two hundred perhaps. Company strength. Perfect spot for an ambush too! And here I am with one sword and a mad doctor.
Where are they off to, the castle?
Aye, they work under his control.
The Red Cap’s control?
Aye.
So he’s the one clearing the Highlands. The question is why? Where do the people he clears out go to?
Some to the city, others to work at Red Cap’s horseheads.
Horseheads? What do you mean, horseheads?
Machines, like great animals. They gather in herds, sucking the blood from the land. If we carry on, you’1ll see them for yourself soon enough.
The sooner I get to the bottom of all this, the better. Hullo... I recognize—
(FAR OFF) Move on there! No talking in the ranks!
Butcher Heyward! There’s a man I’d like at the point of my sword.
Ah, look, this is what we need, the baggage carts.
What of it?
If these Redcoats are making for the Castle, then that’s the quickest way there.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 35
You mean jump on one of those? What if we’re seen?

DOCTOR: I’m not saying he isn’t real, but it sounds to me like someone has taken on the appearance of a myth to strike fear into people.
JAMIE: Whatever he is, it works.
DOCTOR: (WRYLY) And what about Black Donald? Is he a myth as well?
JAMIE: (LAUGHS) Black Donald is what people here call the Devil. To the Redcoats that’s what I am, so that’s who I became.
DOCTOR: Don’t you have a family somewhere, a home?
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 26
JAMIE: The Highlands are my home. My countrymen are my family. That’s all I need.
DOCTOR: (SAD) I see...
JAMIE: But we must go, it’1ll be dark before we get off this mountain. And be on your guard — Mullach Castle, Red Cap’s lair, is just over yon ridge.
DOCTOR: A castle! Well that’s appropriate, I suppose. An important man
DOCTOR: must have an important house.
JAMIE: Aye, and it’s not without defences.
DOCTOR: Soldiers? Redcoats?
JAMTE: Some of them were, once.
DOCTOR: ‘Once’?
JAMIE: We'll be safe if we keep moving. But keep your voice down.
JAMIE: FADE.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 27
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 13: EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE - NIGHT. FADE UP
DOCTOR: I can’t see a thing!
JAMIE: We must lay on.
DOCTOR: Quite an unnatural mist rising up... (SNIFFS) I was rather enjoying stretching my legs in the fresh air, but it’s suddenly lost its appeal. (STUMBLES) Ow! This is absurd. I can’t even see where I’m putting my feet.
JAMIE: (AGITATED) We have to keep moving.
DOCTOR: Jamie, what is it?
JAMIE: Down there is Gladsmuir. There was a battle there, a Jacobite victory and a glorious day by all accounts. But hundreds were killed, on both sides.
DOCTOR: I’m sorry. But I really don’t see how that affects—
JAMIE: There are nights when the dead walk!
DOCTOR: Ghosts? You’re expecting me to believe in ghosts?
JAMIE: Call them what you will but they exist. Listen!.. Do you hear that? The pipes? Can you not hear the pipes?
DOCTOR: Well, yes! Yes I can, but—
JAMIE: He’s come for us!
DOCTOR: Who?
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 28
JAMIE: We’ve got to get down. I’ve got to get away from here. Come on!
DOCTOR: We can’t run in this fog! It’s too dangerous. We have to sit it out.
JAMIE: You heard the piper! He calls the dead.
DOCTOR: Jamie, the only threat I can see is us falling and breaking our necks. This piper could, I don’t know, be... somebody just practising!
JAMIE: No-one lives out here, not anymore.
DOCTOR: (TENSE) What was that? .. Oh, you see! You’ve got me at it now.
JAMIE: No, there! In the fog. Do you not see it?
DOCTOR: Shadows. Just shadows in fog.
JAMIE: No, that’s a man! I’m sure of it.
DOCTOR: What was that?
JAMIE: There he is again. Closer this time.
DOCTOR: (RATTLED) I hear it. But we’ve got to stay calm.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 29
JAMIE: (WHISPERS) It’s the Phantom Piper. He’s come for me. And if you can hear him then... he’s come for us both.
DOCTOR: The McCrimmon Piper?
JAMIE: How do you know that?
DOCTOR: Jamie, I know this is hard for you to understand, but—
JAMIE: They’re coming for us! (MOVING OFF) We must go.
DOCTOR: Jamie, wait. Jamie!
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 14: EXT. MOUNTAINSIDE — CONTINUOUS.
DOCTOR: (OFF) Jamie, will you please stop-???
JAMIE: There’s no time, we’ve got to... (SLIPS) Agh!
JAMIE: (DANGLING) Ah... my God! Doctor!
DOCTOR: (APPROACHING) I’m coming, I’m coming. Where are you?
JAMIE: Here.
DOCTOR: Jamie, good heavens! I didn’t realise we were so close to the edge! Take my hand!
JAMIE: I can’t... I can’t let go. I was right Doctor, the Piper was coming for me.
DOCTOR: No, he’s not. Listen to me... Once before, a long time ago, you thought you saw the Piper. But you had a fever, you saw a metal man, a Cyberman. It was no piper. This is the same, the imagination playing tricks. Shadows in the fog; wind through the mountains. Nothing more. Now take my hand.
JAMIE: I can’t...
DOCTOR: Reach!
JAMIE: ARGH!
DOCTOR: (OVER) Gotcha!
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 31
JAMIE: (BREATHLESS) You saved my life!
DOCTOR: (EXERTED) I’ve done it before. Quite a few times actually.
JAMIE: When? (DISBELIEVING) Oh aye, when you knew me before!
DOCTOR: I think it’s time we got off this rather uncanny mountain, don’t you?
DOCTOR: Yes, Jamie?
JAMIE: Thanks again, for saving my life.
DOCTOR: You’re welcome, Jamie. (MUSIC: A PASSAGE OF TIME.)
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 15: EXT. HIGHLANDS - DAY. FADE UP.
JAMTE: I’ve told you! I’ve no met you before. Not even if you did look shorter or had different hair.. and two friends, and that’s a fact!
DOCTOR: Which is odd.
JAMIE: Oh, odd, is it? And why is that, Doctor?
DOCTOR: (CONFLICTED, ALMOST TO HIMSELF) Well... Hmmm... I’m not sure I should even tell you. I’m not sure I should risk upsetting what the Time Lords—
JAMIE: Ah, them again. There’s only one lord I’ve heard talked about around these parts, and that’s the Overlord.
DOCTOR: And that’s the point. What Overlord? There was no ‘Overlord’ during this time period in Scotland.
JAMIE: ‘Time period’?
DOCTOR: There weren’t any Clearances, either. This whole situation is feeling more and more like a temporal foldback distortion as every minute passes.
JAMIE: Would you like to take a shot at explaining that too?
DOCTOR: No. But even though the Time Lords erased your memory, their erasure took effect after our first encounter. So you should at least have a short memory of me, from before we left in the TARDIS.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 33
JAMIE: Look, Doctor, I can remember my whole life, everything as it was and as it should be.
DOCTOR: Hmmm...
DOCTOR: Someone’s interfering, and it must have something to do with Redcap and this Overlord person.
JAMIE: Iron heels!
DOCTOR: ‘Tron’— ?
JAMIE: Listen!
DOCTOR: That sounds like a train.
JAMIE: What is a ‘train’?
DOCTOR: Of course, we’re a few years too early—
JAMIE: That’s Red Cap, Doctor. Remember I told you he has iron boots? That’s what you can hear. He’s running. Quickly now! Get down behind these rocks.
JAMIE: (SOTTO) Wait... I think... He’s moving away, I think. Yes. (SIGH OF
RELIEF: )
DOCTOR: Get down, Jamie. Redcoats.
DOCTOR: (FX: MARCH PAST CONTINUES. A BODY OF 100+ TROOPS MARCH PAST. HORSES AND CARTS. )
DOCTOR: How many, do you think?
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 34
JAMIE: Two hundred perhaps. Company strength. Perfect spot for an ambush too! And here I am with one sword and a mad doctor.
DOCTOR: Where are they off to, the castle?
JAMIE: Aye, they work under his control.
DOCTOR: The Red Cap’s control?
JAMIE: Aye.
DOCTOR: So he’s the one clearing the Highlands. The question is why? Where do the people he clears out go to?
JAMIE: Some to the city, others to work at Red Cap’s horseheads.
DOCTOR: Horseheads? What do you mean, horseheads?
JAMIE: Machines, like great animals. They gather in herds, sucking the blood from the land. If we carry on, you’1ll see them for yourself soon enough.
DOCTOR: The sooner I get to the bottom of all this, the better. Hullo... I recognize—
HEYWARD: (FAR OFF) Move on there! No talking in the ranks!
JAMIE: Butcher Heyward! There’s a man I’d like at the point of my sword.
DOCTOR: Ah, look, this is what we need, the baggage carts.
JAMIE: What of it?
DOCTOR: If these Redcoats are making for the Castle, then that’s the quickest way there.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 35
JAMIE: You mean jump on one of those? What if we’re seen?
DOCTOR: Then I expect I’1ll be shot as a French spy and you as a brigand. Come on, it beats walking. (MOVING OFF)
JAMIE: (TO HIMSELF) This Doctor doesn’t lack for courage, I’1ll give him that.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 36
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 16: EXT. HIGHLANDS - DAY.
HEYWARD: Move on men. Not much further now.
RILKE: Major Heyward, sir.
HEYWARD: What is it, Sergeant?
RILKE: We’ve caught a couple of Highlanders shadowing the column, sir.
HEYWARD: Out here! Well, have them shot.
RILKE: Begging your pardon, sir... They claim they want to work for the Cap. And they say they have, ‘Important information,’ sir!
HEYWARD: Hm. Oh very well, bring them here.
RILKE: (OFF) Alright, you two. And mind your manners when you’re speaking to the Major.
GUTHRIE: (APPR) Major, we want to work for you sir. We want to work for Red Cap.
HIGHLANDER: Aye, Sir.
HEYWARD: Do you really! And why would you want to do that, you filthy Highland scum?
GUTHRIE: Me and Fergus here — we want to work, sir, we want to eat. We’re so hungry.
HIGHLANDER: So hungry.
HEYWARD: Sergeant, get rid of them.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 37
GUTHRIE: No sir, no sir, wait sir, please. I’ve got news, news I have!
HEYWARD: About what?
GUTHRIE: Black Donald, sir, Black Donald is coming this way with a Frenchman who’s a doctor.
HEYWARD: A doctor! Yes, yes I know this man. And he’s coming here? Why?
GUTHRIE: Don’t know that sir, they just said they was coming. But I can give him to you, yes I can, Will Guthrie can hand him to you on skillet, sir!
HEYWARD: Sergeant — give this man some food. Have the other one shot.
HIGHLANDER: What? But—
RILKE: Major.
HIGHLANDER: No, no, please — (CONTINUES UNDER)
GUTHRIE: Thank you sir, thank you.
RILKE: (MOVING AWAY) Come on you dog, let’s get this over with.
HIGHLANDER: (DRAGGED AWAY) No, no please, God no.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 38
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 17: EXT. HIGHLANDS/CART - DAY.
DOCTOR: Did you hear that?
JAMIE: All I can hear is an axle that needs grease.
DOCTOR: Yes, this isn’t as comfortable as I imagined it would be.
JAMIE: ‘It beats walking’!
DOCTOR: Hmm. So how much further is it?
JAMIE: Shouldn’t be too far.
JAMIE: What are you doing?
DOCTOR: Taking a look. If we’re close then... Good grief!
JAMIE: What?
DOCTOR: Are these your horseheads?
JAMIE: Let me see... Aye, that’s them. Was I not right? Monstrous beasts sucking the life from the land.
DOCTOR: You’re not far wrong. They’re pumpjacks. Machines that lift liquid out of a well.
JAMIE: Aye, I've seen... The black water, the blood of Scotland.
DOCTOR: Black yes, but blood no. Come on, let’s get a closer look.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 39
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 18: EXT. PUMPING FIELD - DAY.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: PUMPJACKS, CLOSER NOW. FOOTSTEPS OF DOCTOR AND JAMIE APPROACH. )
JAMIE: This is a bad place. I can smell it.
DOCTOR: (SNIFFS) Yes. Be careful not to breathe in too deeply.
JAMIE: Aye, the reek of the black water.
DOCTOR: It’s not water, Jamie, it’s oil... at least I think it is. It’1ll be much sought after in another hundred years or so, but—
JAMIE: For what?
DOCTOR: Oh, getting about, plastics, lubricants, all sorts of things. (MUSING) So.. this Red Cap is an oil baron, an old fashioned speculator. Though I’m not sure why he’s in this era other than to beat the rush. Jamie, what are you doing over—?
JAMIE: Doctor look here! I’ve found something.
DOCTOR: What is it? — Oh no.
JAMIE: Some blue box. Hey, didn’t Will Guthrie say —
DOCTOR: Yes, it’s my TARDIS. What’s she doing here?
JAMIE: TAR-DIS?
DOCTOR: My ship. Believe it or not, Jamie, this was your home for a number of years.
JAMIE: As if I'd live for years in a wee box.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 40
DOCTOR: (CLOSE) But how did you get here, old girl, eh?
JAMTE: Doctor, look out!
HEYWARD: Because I had it brought here, Doctor!
DOCTOR: Major Heyward! And why precisely would you do that?
GUTHRIE: (EMERGING) Didn’t I tell you, sir?
JAMIE: Guthrie!?!
GUTHRIE: Didn’t I tell you you’d catch him if you brought his magic box?
JAMTE: You traitor, Guthrie!
HEYWARD: You are the traitor, Black Donald. You and your doctor friend here. Now you will be taken to Mullach Castle. To face Red Cap. To face your punishment.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 41
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 19: EXT. MULLACH CASTLE COURTYARD
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: MACHINERY OFF. LARGE DOOR OPENS. MEN MARCH IN, OVER COBBLES/FLAGSTONES )
DOCTOR: Alright, I can walk by myself you know.
JAMIE: Get your hands off me!
HEYWARD: You'd be well advised to hold your tongue, while you still have a head to keep it in.
DOCTOR: Well where is he? I’m waiting. I’m a very busy man you know.
JAMIE: That’s him!
HEYWARD: Master Red Cap, these are the two men I was telling you about.
JAMIE: (TERRIFIED) What in the name of—?
RED: CAP (IMPOSSIBLY DEEP VOICE) This is one called Doctor?
HEYWARD: It is.
RED: CAP Red Cap will know why you are here.
DOCTOR: You're right, Jamie. He is rather short.
JAMIE: Doctor!
DOCTOR: And I suppose the oversize work boots, grey boiler suit and red hard hat are fine if you’re after the ‘oil worker on steroids’ look.
RED: CAP What is blue box?
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 42
HEYWARD: Your lordship, he referred to it as the ‘TARDIS’.
RED: CAP
TAR: — DIS. What is its use?
DOCTOR: It’s just a box.
RED: CAP Doctor will open.
DOCTOR: Doctor will not open. I can see what you’re doing here, taking on the guise of some bogeyman from Scottish legend to terrify the locals into doing your bidding. Well, it won’t work on me! Or on Donald, come to that. Isn’t that right, Donald?
JAMIE: (SCARED WITLESS) A-aye! Doctor, are you sure about [this-?]
RED: CAP
DOCTOR: WILL OPEN BOX!
DOCTOR: Doctor will not! Who are you really, and why do you want the oil?
DOCTOR: You do realise you’re contaminating the timeline?
RED: CAP I know nothing of timeline? Open box!
DOCTOR: I will not! I can play this game for hours, you know.
DOCTOR: Ugh! (GASPS, BADLY HURT)
JAMIE: You touch him again and—!
RED: CAP No speak! Hours you have, Doctor. Days you do not. Tomorrow you will open box. If box not open, Red Cap will have your blood.
RED: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 43

elements.text: PART TWO
SCENE 20: INT. DUNGEON (LATER)
FX: FADE UP. DRIPPING WATER ON STONE
Och, Doctor — there must be some way out of this hole!
I’ve been in worse dungeons, Jamie.
We can at least try!
I daresay the gentleman in the shackles opposite thought much the same once. Judging by his state of decomposition, he’s had thirty years to reconsider the likelihood of escape.
(SITS) Reckon you’re right. So you’1ll open your blue box for Red Cap? Your ‘TAR-DIS’?
I will not.
What if he just breaks it open himself?
My dear Jamie, the assembled hordes of Genghis Khan couldn’t break it open. And even if he takes the key it won’t do him any good, the lock has an advanced meson recognition system.
Sounds like witchcraft.
That depends on how you look at it. Really, there’s nothing in there. And then again, there’s everything.
Now you’re speaking in riddles.
You understood once. For a long time you called the TARDIS home.
As I've said, I have none of those memories.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 44
Hmm... Now, I’m going to have a nap and I advise you to do the same.
How can you sleep at a time like this?
Well, it’s better than pacing the floor all night. Try and keep the noise down, there’s a good chap.
FX: 2 x FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING FROM OTHER SIDE OF DOOR...
Someone’s coming!
(OFF) Stand away from the door.
FX: KEYS JANGLE. KEY IN LOCK. DOOR OPENS
(OFF) Go on then, girl, get in there.
FX: WOMAN ENTERS, PUTS DOWN JUG AND PLATE
CYPRIEN I’ve brought you some water and bread. The water is fresh but the bread is yesterday’s.
Thank you, hen.
CYPRIEN It’s not much, but —
I’m sure it will suffice. I’m the Doctor, by the way, and this is
(MOUTHFUL OF BREAD, MUFFLED) — Black Donald.
The fearsome Black Donald, otherwise known as Jamie MacCrimmon.
(OFF) No talking!
CYPRIEN I know who he is. It’s said you walked here?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 45
Aye, and I must have had a blow to the head to do it.
I suppose you’ve heard we’re to be executed tomorrow?
(OFF) Come on out, woman, or I’1l drag ye by yer tresses-!
CYPRIEN (WHISPERS) At four bells be ready.
FX: SHE EXITS. DOOR SLAMS. LOCKED
Poor scared bairn! — What did she mean, four bells?
I rather think, Jamie, we just encountered Providence.
Providence, eh? Strange sort of name for a lassie.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 46
SCENE 21: EXT. CASTLE COURTYARD
CAP
CALLING BACK) Bring blue box into Keep. (WALKS
(CALLING BACK) You heard the Cap! Get to it!
(FX: CREAKING OF CART, ETC AS MEN BEGIN MOVING TARDIS OFF. FOLLOW HEYWARD AND RED CAP AS THEY WALK ACROSS COURTYARD )
(TROTTING AFTER RED CAP) Master Cap — forgive me-?
CAP (WALKING) What Heyward want now?
(WALKING) This blue box. Shouldn’t we inform the Overlord?
CAP (WALKING) I will see inside first.
Oh, I know your game. Take a cut of the treasure for yourself, is that [it —?] (GRABBED BY THROAT, CHOKING)
CAP (STOPPED, CHOKING HEYWARD) There is no treasure in box!
(GAGGING) I jest-!
CAP Jest-? (LETS HIM GO)
(NURSING THROAT) Forgive me, Master Cap.
CAP Feel box. Box has power. Box is not of this land!
Course it isn’t. That Doctor, he’s most likely a Frenchman.
CAP I must know more of box. Of its power. (DECISIVELY) You send word of box to Master of Lammermoor.
That cursed creature-? My men know better than to venture into his estate.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 47
CAP He is man of much knowledge. Man of your God. He may know how to open box, if Doctor refuses.
What I’ve heard tell of that fellow doesn’t bear repeating. And as for that woman, his housekeep - the one with her head all askew — (SHUDDERS)
CAP You send word! (EXITS)
(TO SELF) Oh, I’1ll send word. But if the Overlord finds out you’ve kept the Doctor’s treasure box from him — well, on your Cap be it...
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 48
SCENE 22: INT. DUNGEON
SNORES
Humpfh, how can you sleep at a time like this?
FX: FOUR BELLS TOLL OFF
Four bells. Jamie. (PRODDING JAMIE) Jamie!
Whassat-—?
Four bells. Be ready.
What for? Breakfast?
FX: KEY IN LOCK. DOOR OPENS
Hey, it’s Providence-!
CYPRIEN (HUSHED, URGENT) Hush. Quickly, we must away.
Away where?
CYPRIEN The jailer’s asleep in a stupor, but might wake any minute. Away, while there’s time.
There’s always time, if you know where to look.
Doctor, you heard the lassie. Away!
And what if this providential “escape” is some kind of ruse concocted by Red Cap, hm? To persuade me to open my box?
What, a trap-?
CYPRIEN There is no ruse, sir! I am risking my life!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 49
(MOLLIFYING) Perhaps you could start by telling us exactly who you are?
CYPRIEN My name is Mrs Cyprien. Mrs Alice Cyprien.
Doctor, but [you said —]
I’m very pleased to meet you, Mrs Cyprien. Now, why are you here?
CYPRIEN I am a prisoner here, the same as you. Not of Red Cap, mind, he’s just my jailer. I was sent here by the Overlord he serves.
There’s that name again.
CYPRIEN
I’ve been here over a year now. And I must get out, I simply must. I’ve tried before, but the Cap always finds me. But — with Black Donald by my side — perhaps, I stand a chance.
(FLATTERED) Aye, well — I’m convinced.
You astound me.
FX: DOOR CLANGS OFF. JAMIE CROSSES
CYPRIEN Please, we must go.
Corridor’s clear.
Alright, lead the way.
CONTINUES INTO:
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 50
SCENE 23: INT. CASTLE CORRIDORS (CONTINUOUS)
FX: JAILER SNORING OFF
CYPRIEN
Quietly now, this way. At the end of the corridor is a gate they use to take out the dead. It’s never guarded at night, as the stories say it’s haunted.
How do we know it isn’t?
Jamie, please! A few ghosts are the least of our worries right now —
Easy for you to say —
CYPRIEN ‘Jamie’?
Aye, well — that’s my name. Jamie McCrimmon.
‘Black Donald’, you see, is Jamie’s ‘nom de guerre’ —
What’s that you’re saying, Frenchman?
CYPRIEN He’s no Frenchman. I should know. (WALKING) Please, we must hurry!
(FOLLOWING) I need to know who this Overlord character is. I’ve heard his name several times already.
(WALKING) Aye, come to Edinburgh from abroad, some say.
And you didn’t think of sharing this information sooner?
Aye, sorry.
CYPRIEN (STOPPED) Here, the gate. (FX: CREAKING GATE) And quiet, please. Someone will hear us.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 51
(IN CORRIDOR BEHIND GATE, OFF AND APPROACHING) Someone already has, my pretty.
Will Guthrie! If I had my sword I’d end you, by God I would!
Ah, then it’s a good job I have it, and you don’t.
FX: PULLS SWORD
I’d be careful what you do with that if I was you.
Oh I shall, as long as you all turn round and go back the way you came. I’m thinking the Cap will reward me handsomely for this night’s work.
Damn your eyes. You’re a Highlander, Guthrie.

And what has that ever brought me but hardship and hunger? I knew you'd try something, oh yes. I knew you’d be plotting to get out while the rest of us slept. The Donald I knew wouldn’t take fright at a few tales of ghosties, would he now?
(TO OTHERS) Maybe we’d better do as he says.
Aye that’s it, Frenchie.
I’m not taking orders from him.
He does have us at a disadvantage. Though admittedly there are three of us and only one of him.
Hey, try anything and I’11 run you through.
Oh, I think you’re hardly likely to kill me. Red Cap will never get into that blue box of mine, if I’m dead.
That’s what you think, Frenchie. Me, I heard the Cap’s got someone coming to do the job. A sorcerer, perhaps.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 52
(SNORTS) Sorcerer!
Laugh all you like, that still leaves Donald here, and the raggedy lassie.
C’moan then, Will Guthrie. Let’s see if you’ve the guts for it.
Jamie, don’t —
Och, it’s not like he’s ever had the stomach for a proper fight —
(CHARGING AT JAMIE) Loch moigh — [!!!] (GRABBED FROM BEHIND) Urk!
CYPRIEN (CLAWING AT GUTHRIE) Call me... raggedy, would you-? I — ama — gentlewoman!
Apparently not so gentle right now —
FX: GUTHRIE DROPS SWORD — CLATTER
I’ll have that — (FX: SWORD PICKED UP) Let him go, hen.
GUTHRIE & MRS CYPRIEN BREAK OFF, PANTING
(HELPING HER UP) Are you alright, Alice?
CYPRIEN Mrs Cyprien. Yes.
Now then, Will Guthrie. I ought to cut you down where you stand, you dog.
Please, Donald, I meant you no harm, honest I didn’t. I was just hungry, that’s all.
You think I’m not? Nor any of your fellow countrymen? Will Guthrie, as clan chief, I banish you from the realms of your clan and from the Highlands entire. Now get you from my sight.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 53
FX: GUTHRIE RUNS
Jamie, no! — Quickly, we must go.
What? I couldn’t just kill the man in cold blood.
I didn’t expect you to.
CYPRIEN But he’1ll raise the alarm.
Ah, you’re right!
We should have brought him with us.
Well why didn’t you say so-?
CYPRIEN Ssh! Quickly, this way —
FX: GATE CREAKS. THEY EXIT
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 54
SCENE 24: INT. CASTLE. MAIN HALL (MOMENTS LATER)
(RUSHING IN) Everybody! Everybody up!
(APPR) What the devil-? You, Highlander — what’s the meaning of this-?
The prisoners have escaped, Major! Black Donald, and the Frenchie, too!
What? But — (CALLS OFF) Sergeant! Sergeant! Call out the guard! — (FX: BUSTLING OF 2 x REDCOATS OFF) And as for you, Highlander...
FX: RED CAP APPRS.
. what were you doing down there anyway? Eh? Did you help them?
No, I swear. I was trying to stop them.
CAP (APPROACHING) One called Doctor is where?
Master Cap — it seems the prisoners have effected an escape. As we speak, [I am...]
CAP Stop. — (TO GUTHRIE) You! You raised alarm?
Yes. Yes, Master Cap.
CAP Why you not stop them?

MRS: CYPRIEN I just... I just don’t know what to think.
DOCTOR: I’m sure we’ll get to the bottom of everything soon. At least we're heading in the right direction.
MRS: CYPRIEN Yes, the cart-loads of barrels make that very clear.
JAMIE: They call it “the road of blood”.
DOCTOR: The main route for the convoys in and out of Grangemouth. So many carts. So much oil —
JAMIE: Black water! Damn the stuff! What does the Overlord use it all for, I’d like to know?
MRS: CYPRIEN I’ve no idea.
DOCTOR: Does everything that comes out of Red Cap’s wells go to the same
DOCTOR: place?
JAMIE: I don’t know. But it’s not just that one place Doctor, look around you.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 75
DOCTOR: Good grief. It’s like Texas! Pumpjacks! As far as the eye can see. And over there, see, those look like factories.
JAMIE: What’s that, then?
DOCTOR: A place where things are made. The stone and iron that came out of the Great Maw, it all has to be refined, processed.
JAMIE: (NOT COMPREHENDING) Oh, aye.
DOCTOR: It’s the Clearances all over again — only this time for industry, not agriculture. There’s a dark hand at work here, Jamie, one that cares nothing for human suffering... or history, come to that. How’s he done it? All this? It’s too much for one man, he’d have needed allies. Associates.
JAMIE: Collaborators, aye.
MRS: CYPRIEN Don’t say that-!
DOCTOR: Mrs Cyprien?
MRS: CYPRIEN Don’t... say that word. Please.
DOCTOR: Is something wrong? Alice?
MRS: CYPRIEN He was made to do it, I promise you. He’s not a bad man, I know he isn’t! But you’1ll think bad of him and he doesn’t deserve it.
JAMIE: Who the devil d’you mean, woman?
MRS: CYPRIEN My husband. Victor, Victor Cyprien. He’s an engineer, he...
DOCTOR: It’s alright, tell us in your own time.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 76
MRS: CYPRIEN One day the Overlord came for Victor. I didn’t see him for myself, but...
DOCTOR: Go on.
MRS: CYPRIEN
MRS: . I heard him from outside the door, heard that terrible rasping voice. He asked Victor to work for him, constructing mechanisms from his designs.
DOCTOR: What sort of designs-?
MRS: CYPRIEN Machines for digging, drilling, building, far outside the human scale. Amazing things. Terrible things.
JAMIE: And he agreed-?
MRS: CYPRIEN
MRS: Victor refused. These things were against nature, he said. They argued. Later, Victor told me that the Overlord had threatened him, saying he’d see to it that Victor did as he’d asked.
JAMIE: How?
DOCTOR: Isn’t it obvious? (TO MRS C) He kidnapped you, didn’t he?
MRS: CYPRIEN
MRS: Yes. I was walking along the street in Edinburgh when the Redcoats took me. I was put into a carriage and brought to the castle, where I found you. I don’t know if Victor even knows I’m alive.
DOCTOR: He must do, if he thought you were dead... the Overlord would have no power over him. Mrs Cyprien.. Alice.. these derricks and pumpjacks may be vile, but they should also give you hope. They are a very clear sign of your husband’s love for you.
JAMIE: I suppose they are at that.
MRS: CYPRIEN I hadn’t thought of them that way.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 77
DOCTOR: Well I suggest you do, because you’re on your way back to him and...
DOCTOR: Get down, both of you-!
JAMIE: An ambush!
RILKE: (OFF) Get under cover! Under cover and mark your targets!
MRS: CYPRIEN Ambush-? By who-?
JAMIE: Highlanders, I reckon. We’re still in my territory. (CALLING OFF) Over here! Hold your fire-!
JAMIE: Hey, what d’you think you’re playing at-?
DOCTOR: They’re Highlanders all right, but they can’t identify us ata distance.
JAMIE: You’re right. Let’s get under the cart.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 78
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 35: EXT. GREAT SOUTHERN ROAD — UNDER CART (CONTINUOUS)
RILKE: (OFF) Hold the line, lads! Keep firing!
RILKE: (FX: MUSKET BALLS IMPACT ON WOOD. OFF, BATTLE REIGNS. MUSKET FIRE, SWORD ON SHIELD, HORSES, ETC)
DOCTOR: That’s better. — Can you see who it is yet?
JAMIE: See there, that’s the Buchanan tartan, there the MacNaughton. Fighting together, jings man, that’s a heart-warming sight.
DOCTOR: What’s that-?
MRS: CYPRIEN (ALARMED) They’re coming towards us-!
JAMIE: Well will you look at that? That’s a shellycoat!
DOCTOR: A shellycoat? I thought they were a legend.
MRS: CYPRIEN It looks real enough to me.
JAMIE: Aye, a river bogey who wears a coat of shells.
DOCTOR: Well, a man dressed up to look like one, at least. (THOUGHFULLY ) Like Red Cap — dressed to impress? And I have to say, it works!
JAMIE: I mean what I say Doctor. They’re true Scots folk.
MRS: CYPRIEN Look! He’s wounded. Oh Doctor, can’t we do something?
DOCTOR: Stay here.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 79
JAMIE: Doctor no, you’ll.. Ach.. that man has a death wish.
HEYWARD: (OFF, IN BACKGROUND) Bring the carts round! Form a defensive circle!
SHELLYCOAT: (COARSE, THROATY) Ah, touch me you devil and I’11 take you with me, so I will!
DOCTOR: Easy, easy, I’m a friend.
SHELLYCOAT: Are you a Scotsman?
DOCTOR: Honorary, I hope. Now let’s get you under cover.
SHELLYCOAT: Agh, the Redcoats’ve finished me. Finished all of my kind.
DOCTOR: Your kind? You mean the Scots?
SHELLYCOAT: The blood, the essence, the wellspring of all things is being drained. All we are... all we become... He’11 kill us. Kill us all...
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 80
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 36: EXT. GREAT SOUTHERN ROAD (ELSEWHERE)
RILKE: (APPROACHING) Sir, they’re picking us off, permission to withdraw.
HEYWARD: Hold them, man, hold them! They’re after the black water, trying to disrupt supplies. This is the fifth attack this month, so it’s time we taught them a lesson.
RILKE: Maybe they heard the Cap’s gone sir?
HEYWARD: Hardly, it’s not as if there aren’t more where he... wait a minute, of course!
RILKE: Sir?
HEYWARD: The prisoners. Bring three men and follow me. Double time, Sergeant!
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 81
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 37: EXT. GREAT SOUTHERN ROAD — UNDER CART
JAMIE: Doctor! Is yon shellycoat dead?
DOCTOR: I’m afraid so. Poor devil —
MRS: CYPRIEN
DOCTOR: We’re rather caught between a rock and a hard place here.
JAMIE: Aye, I’m not used to being shot at by my own side, I have to say.
MRS: CYPRIEN But only the Redcoats can take us to the Overlord.
DOCTOR: Quite a dilemma.
JAMIE: Seems to me as though the Highlanders have the upper hand. You see there, they’re breaking the English lines. I say we make a run for it. Head for the burn there.
DOCTOR: Jamie, none of us is bulletproof!
RILKE: (APPROACHING) You three. Stand!
HEYWARD: (APPROACHING) You heard the Sergeant!
JAMIE: Oh, what’s he want now-?
HEYWARD: Black Donald, these are your men, yes?
JAMIE: Well, they’re Highlanders.
HEYWARD: Then tell them to lay down their arms.
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 82
JAMIE: I will not.
HEYWARD: Sergeant — kill the girl.
RILKE: (FX: COCKING PISTOL) Sir-!
DOCTOR: Er, I don’t think you should do that.
HEYWARD: I didn’t ask for your opinion, Doctor.
DOCTOR: No, but I’m giving it to you all the same. Not only is Mrs Cyprien an innocent in all this, but I don’t believe you realise how important to the Overlord she is.
HEYWARD: Stand down, Sergeant.
RILKE: (SULKY) Sir.
MRS: CYPRIEN (SOTTO) Thank you, Doctor.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Don’t thank me yet.
HEYWARD: Alright, Sergeant, form a firing squad.
RILKE: Be my pleasure, sir. (ASIDE) Squad — assemble!
DOCTOR: I don’t like the way this is going.
MRS: CYPRIEN No, neither do I.
RILKE: Present — arms!
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 83
HEYWARD: Donald, tell your men to lay down their arms, or I’1l send them your body. That should take the fight out of them.
DOCTOR: Now just a minute, Major.
HEYWARD: Silence!
JAMIE: It’s alright, Doctor. I decided long ago that I was ready to die for Scotland.
DOCTOR: The Overlord will want to see both of us, Heyward. Don’t you realise that?
HEYWARD: You? Some Frenchman of no account?
DOCTOR: Just as Red Cap served the Overlord, Black Donald serves me. He is my lieutenant, and those Highlanders out there are my rescue party. I’m extremely important to them.
HEYWARD: I always knew there was more to you than met the eye, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Indeed.
JAMIE: Oh, Doctor, what have you done now-?
HEYWARD: Alright Sergeant, you heard him. Shoot the pair of them.
MRS: CYPRIEN No! You mustn’t!
RILKE: Ready —
JAMIE: Full of good ideas, aren’t you, Doctor?
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 84
RILKE: . Aim —
DOCTOR: I’m sorry, Jamie. I meant to make us more of a prize, alive!
RILKE: Fire-!
RILKE: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 85

elements.text: PART THREE
Just as Red Cap served the Overlord, Black Donald serves me. He is my lieutenant, and those Highlanders out there are my rescue party. I’m extremely important to them.
BEAT
I always knew there was more to you than met the eye, Doctor.
Indeed.
Oh, Doctor, what have you done now-?
Alright Sergeant, you heard him. Shoot them pair of them.
CYPRIEN No! You mustn’t!

FX: GUNS COCKED

. Aim —

FX: FUSILLADE OF SHOTS. SCENE CONTINUES:
SCENE 38: EXT. GREAT SOUTHERN ROAD (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: THE SHOTS TAKE OUT THE FIRING SQUAD. REDCOATS CRY OUT AND 3 X BODIES SLUMP TO FLOOR, CLATTER OF MUSKETS)
Squad-?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 86
They’re dead. Get down, you fool!
Dead-?!?
FX: HIGHLANDERS CHARGING FROM OFF
Up on the hill! The lads are breaking through-!
CYPRIEN Like devils in skirts. Saints preserve us-!
Sir, we’re over-run. (FX: COCKS PISTOL) Let me finish this pair myself —
I’d save your ammunition if I were you, Sergeant.
Aye, looks like you’1ll be needing it.
(TO RILKE) Withdraw, Sergeant! (MOVING OFF) This isn’t over Doctor, not yet.
(CALLING AFTER) G’wan! Back under the stone you crawled out from, Redcoat!
Never mind them, Jamie. Talk to your people-!
My people, aye —
CYPRIEN Before they slaughter us, too?
Here, Doctor — gi’us a leg-up, onto the cart.
If I must — (TAKES WEIGHT)
Don’t look up, eh? (STEPS UP)
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 87
I wasn’t about to!
FX: JAMIE SCRAMBLES ATOP CART
(CALLS) Highlanders! Scotsmen! Stay your guns!
FX: A SHOT ZINGS OVER
Black Donald commands ye. Stay your guns, and yield to me!
FX: NO MORE SHOTS
ROY (OFF, APPR) What? Yield to you?!? Yield to the fatherless cur of the mountains?!?
FX: HIGHLANDERS LAUGH
Who said that?
ROY (BELOW) I said it. Come down from your perch, and meet me face to face — if you’re man enough!
You! I might have known! Right — (FX: JUMPS OFF CART) You’1ll eat those words, you scunner —
ROY Scunner, am I? Put ‘em up, I’1l make ye ‘Black an’ blue Donald’ from this day forth —
Ye want some, do ye? C’moan then, I’ve got plenty for the likes o’ you —
(RUSHING OUT FROM BEHIND CART) Might I just interject, before you two gentlemen butt heads?
Stay back, Doctor, this is clan business-!
All the same. Please.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 88
ROY What’s this creature of yours, Donald? Looks like some Yankee doodle.
I suppose it makes a change from ‘Frenchie’. I am the Doctor. The lady hiding behind the cart is Mrs Alice Cyprien —
CYPRIEN (OFF, NERVOUS) H-hello-?
. and Donald here, it seems you know. We’re all late of the Red Cap’s hospitality. Now, whom do I have the pleasure of addressing?
ROY Which Red Cap?
There’s more than one?
Him at Mullach Castle. And my Doctor bested him in battle, so best not to trifle with us — Rob Roy MacGregor!
What-?
ROY I’d heard the Cap at Mullach had been brought down, [but —]
I’m sorry, did he say [‘Rob Roy MacGregor’? ]
Aye, Rob Roy MacGregor, of the clan MacGregor.
(LAUGHS) You’re Rob Roy-?
ROY Aye, and I’11 thank you not to laugh in my face, Yankee!
I’m sorry. What with fake mythic monsters, pretend spooks, now someone claiming to be a man who’s been dead for forty years? I mean, honestly — (GRABBED BY THROAT)
ROY (HOLDING DOCTOR) I am who I say I am. Who in Satan’s name are you?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 89
Put him down, Rob. It’s like I say: he’s the fellow that bested the Cap.
ROY Then — (LETS DOCTOR GO)
(GASPS) Thank you —
ROY . you're a friend of Scotland, and a friend of Scotland is a friend of mine.
Well said, Rob Roy MacGregor. Aye, and thank you for rescuin’ us when you did.
Not that we needed rescuing, of course —
ROY I didn’t rescue your useless hide, Donald. It was the convoy we wanted.
How d’you mean-?
ROY We’re stopping as many aS we can, pouring the black water back onto the land. (CALLS OFF) C’moan, boys!
Aye!!!
(FX: HIGHLANDERS RUSH FORWARD. MONTAGE: BARRELS ROLLING, AXES
WOOD, LIQUID GUSHING, HIGHLANDERS CHEERING. OVER THIS: )
ROY That’s the way, boys. Break the barrels, pour Scotland’s blood back!
FX: CROSSFADE TO:

SCENE 39: EXT. GREAT SOUTHERN ROAD (NIGHT
FX: NIGHT CREATURES. CAMP FIRE
(APPR) Hey there, Mrs C. You cold-?
CYPRIEN Half-frozen, yes. Despite the fire.
(SITTING) Here, I got ye a Redcoat’s red coat. Never mind the blood, it won’t show once it’s dried.
CYPRIEN Thank you, but I’1ll manage.
Suit yerself.
CYPRIEN Where’s the Doctor?
(OFF) Are you always so obstreperous, or do you just not comprehend-?
Over yonder, rowing with Rob. Best leave them to it.
FX: CROSS TO — TEN FEET AWAY
(WALKING) .. We need to go where the convoy was going.
ROY (WALKING) Aye, you said. But only a madman would willingly enter the city of spires!
(WALKING) Grangemouth?
ROY
(WALKING) That’s what some call it. Between what was Glasgow and Edinburgh, the Overlord has built himself a city. A city as tall aS a mountain and as gleaming as a bag of snakes.
(STOPPED) Well, we want to go there!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 91
ROY
(STOPPED) I told you, you cannae go there. The Overlord knows there’s a rebellion coming. He has the city gates guarded tighter than an army drum.
But he lets these convoys through?
ROY A steady stream, all day and all night.
Then that’s how we get in!
(APPR) I don’t know if I’m of a mind to get arrested all over again.
CYPRIEN (APPR) No, no — the Doctor’s right!
Listen. We have carts here, don’t we? If you lend us some men, Rob, we can drive this convoy right into the city.
ROY And why in the Saints’ names would I do that? Stay here, help us stop the convoys and we’1l bleed the Overlord out!
CYPRIEN But I have to get into the city. I have to find Victor-!
See here, hen — every convoy has a military escort. And we don’t!
CYPRIEN Could we not take the coats off the poor souls you’ve killed here? Like the one you offered me-?
Aye, that could work. I’m not wearing no Redcoat, mind. I’d sooner hang.
We’ll have to move fast. Heyward has already stolen a march on us.
ROY Did you not hear me? We stay here, we fight here, this is where we can cause the Overlord the most pain.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 92
No, it isn’t! Look, Rob Roy was — I mean, is — a great leader of men. Scotland’s own Robin Hood. You of all people should see the wisdom of going into the enemy’s camp.
ROY Aye...
Think about it, a few men can do far more damage there than here. Sabotage the machines, raise a rebellion.
Strike at the heart of the Overlord’s power.
It could be the turning point you’ve been looking for.
ROY (MOVING OFF) Come on then, Donald, let’s get those uniforms collected.
(MOVING OFF) And make these carts into something like a proper convoy.
CYPRIEN A fine speech, Doctor.
It was rather, wasn’t it?
MUSIC.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 93
SCENE 40: EXT. GRANGEMOUTH APPROACH (ON CARTS)
FX: FADE UP. BUCK AND RUMBLE OF CARTS, HORSES
ROY (OFF) Keep those carts moving, lads.
CYPRIEN Doctor, I feel I must confide in you. I’m worried about Victor.
You’re on your way to see him. There’s no need to worry.
CYPRIEN Rob Roy may not understand, he was forced to do what he did. I don’t want any harm to come to him.
And none shall. That I promise you.
FX: THUMPING OF INDUSTRY OFF, APPROACHING SITE
Doctor, do you see that?
CYPRIEN Oh! Is that Grangemouth?
(IN AWE, ALMOST TO HIMSELF) The City of Spires. More like a future, nightmare vision of New York!
OFF, FURTHER AHEAD) Wo-a-ah! (FX: CARTS STOP
(CALLING UP) Hey there, Rob. What’s with the delay-?
ROY
(APPROACHING) A communication from further along the road: seems as the Redcoats are seeking a French dandy, travelling with Black Donald and a young woman.
I presume, therefore, Major Heyward made it back safely.
He must have marched like Red Cap himself. So what now?
ROY Turn back of course! There’s nothing more to be done.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 94
You’re never going to clear the English from Scotland with that attitude.
ROY There’s only so much I’11 take from your tongue, [you dandified—]
The first casualty of war is the plan. We have to adapt, that’s all. These empty barrels we’re carrying —
ROY What about them-?
(REALISES DOCTOR’S PLAN) Oh, you cannae be serious!
I’m sorry, Jamie, but you and Mrs Cyprien are going to have to travel inside these barrels.
We’ll never fit in those! Well, Mrs C, maybe...
CYPRIEN I’1l do whatever’s necessary, to get inside the city.
It won’t be for long.
It had better not be.
I promise. Now, (FX: DONNING RED COAT) .. if I can just borrow this red coat —
So what are you going to do, while we’re in yon barrels?
An act of dissembling. Cap at a jaunty angle, and... How do I look?
Like a Frenchman!
ROY Into the barrels, then. Quickly!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 95
SCENE 41: EXT. GRANGEMOUTH CHECKPOINT (ON CART)
FX: CART IN MOTION. DISTANT THUMP OF MACHINERY
(MUFFLED) Can’t you go any faster? It’s hard to breathe!
(DRIVING CART) I’m doing my best. I don’t think these horses like me —
FX: HORSES SNORT, STRAINING
(MUFFLED) I cannae imagine why.
(OFF) Halt! Halt there, I say!
Quiet now, we’re approaching the checkpoint. Rob —
ROY (BESIDE HIM) Aye-?
Head down, and I’1l1 do the talking. (RUSTIC NORFOLK FROM HERE) Woah there-!
FX: CART STOPS. HORSES STAMP
(APPR) State your business, soldier!
This be a convoy for the Overlord, what you stopping us for?
There’s no convoy due til dawn.
Well, we’re ‘ere.
I can’t let you in, you’re not on my list! I can’t let you in if you’re not on my list.
Lad, we’re not on your list, because... well, we... (INSPIRATION) we’re dead!
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 96
Wh-what ?
Recognise the tunic? We’re all that’s left of the 78 Foot. Major Heyward’s men-?
Then — you are dead!
Ah, but we’re born again as heroes, lad. Attacked by hundreds of hairy Highlanders, we were. Rob Roy himself reared up in front of the Major —
ROY (BAD ENGLISH ACCENT) .. eight foot tall, he was.
You be quiet, I’m tellin’ it. I yelled, ‘Major, run for your life.’ And so he did, all the way to Grangemouth.
Then what?
Then lad, Black Donald himself appeared. Hair in thistles, murder in his wild eyes!
MUFFLED COUGH

Killed half us rearguard with his bare hands. Still — here we are, with the last of the Mullach water. Now, lad — you go find the Major, and you explain to him why the platoon that saved his very neck, is left waiting in a Scottish fog on a sentry’s pleasure?
BEAT
(CALLS) Let them pass!
FX: CART MOVES OFF.
(SOTTO, TO ROB. NO ACCENT) Eight foot tall — hmph!
ROY (SOTTO) I got my reputation to consider.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 97
EXT. GRANGEMOUTH STREET (MINUTES LATER
FX: FADE UP. CART IN MOTION. INDUSTRY OFF
ROY What an awful place this is!
An industrial compound the size of a minor metropolis. Oh, but this is appalling. Let alone the consequences for the environment, damage to the timeline on such a scale — well, it’s unprecedented!
ROY I went to what remains of Fort William once, and that was bad enough. But this, this is how I imagined hell to look.
Yes. Dark satanic mills, for sure...
ROY We’re far enough now, pull over.
FX: CARTS STOP
ROY C’mon, lads. Let’s get these barrels over —
FX: 2 X BARRELS KNOCKED OVER
Rob, you see to Mrs Cyprien.
FX: 2 x HAMMERINGS, KNOCKING TOPS OF BARRELS
GASPS FOR AIR
Jamie?
(GROGGY) Hair like thistles, have I?
I was busking it. How are you doing, Mrs Cyprien-?
CYPRIEN (SHORT OF BREATH) I will — survive. Are we in-?
We are, aye.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 98
CYPRIEN It was worth it, then. We must get to Victor.
ROY Doctor, we shouldn’t linger here.
Have to say, the Rob’s right.
ROY And there’s sure to be word sent to Heyward. The streets’1l be crawling with Redcoats like lice on a beggar.
Quite.
ROY So it’s here we go our separate ways.
Surely it’s better if we stay together. Strength in numbers?
ROY I came to raise rebellion, so I’m away to see what favour me and Donald have here. Will you join me, Donald?
Later, Rob. I must see the Doctor and Mrs C safe first. We’ve come this far together, we shouldn’t part now.
Good man.
ROY Aye, well, I’ve three good lads with me. I’1ll go my own way. But if you have need of me, send word, I’1ll come if I can.
Good luck.
ROY And with you. — (OFF) Come lads. (FX: ROB & 3 x HIGHLANDERS EXIT)
So, now what?
Now, we find Victor Cyprien.
CYPRIEN Yes, but how-?
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 99
SCENE 42: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE FACTORY
(FX: CLANGS, CLANKS OF CLOCKWORK FACTORY INTERIOR. CUT TO OUTSIDE. DOCTOR, JAMIE & MRS C WALKING PAST)
I cannae make out what they’re makin’ in these fack-tories 0’ yours, Doctor.
Hard to say. Perhaps — clockwork mechanisms, or some sort of control apparatus-?
(UNCONVINCING) Oh aye, that’1ll be it.
CYPRIEN Please, we have no time for sight-seeing-!
My dear Mrs Cyprien, I assure you tourism is the least of my objectives.
FX: BLIND BEGGAR SHUFFLING FORWARD, TAPPING STICK
Perhaps this auld feller here can help-? (STRIDING FORWARD) Hey there!
BEGGAR Who’s that? Who spoke-?
We’re lookin’ for a gentleman, goes by the name o’ Victor Cyprien
BEGGAR Ah, well — I’m at a certain disadvantage where it comes to lookin’, sir...
CYPRIEN Poor soul, he’s blind.
BEGGAR Aye, ever since a shower of sparks in the smelting works did for my eyes.
I’m so sorry.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 100
BEGGAR Spare us your pity, sir. It’s bread I need. Bread — or cheese, perhaps?
CYPRIEN We have nothing, I’m afraid.
BEGGAR Then you wants to find some. Cheese brings rats, lassie. And rats is good eating.
Uuurgh-!
(CUTTING OVER) We’ll be sure to remember that. But, before you go — please. Victor Cyprien. He’s an important man.
CYPRIEN A Frenchman.
A Frenchman-?
Bien sur —
BEGGAR (AGITATED) What — not the Frenchman?
Possibly —
BEGGAR You don’t want him! You don’t want nothing to do with him. He made the machines, they say. The machines that cost me my eyes!
CYPRIEN (HORRIFIED) Oh, my —
FX: FACTORY WHISTLE BEGINS. OVER
Och, what’s with the banshee shriek-?
Change of shift, perhaps?
FX: CUT WHISTLE
BEGGAR Aye, the press gangs’1ll be comin’ out.
CITY OF SPIRES by Simon Bovey (FINAL) Page 101
Press gangs-?
BEGGAR Please, I must be away-!

FX: FADE UP. THUMPING FROM INSIDE OF LARGE PIPE, OFF
